body.name: Damia's Children: Tower and Hive, Book 3
body.description: In Damia's Children, one of science fiction and fantasy's most beloved novelists, Anne McCaffrey, continues the story of psychic Talent begun with The Rowan and Damia. The Rowan's next generation of passionate and talented descendants prepare to defend their worlds against an alien attack of mysterious origin. Damia had deflected a previous attack on the human worlds and sent the aliens into deep space. Hungry for more living space, they return with plans to dominate, armed with knowledge of the psychic defense they can expect from humanity.However, as it has been learned that Talent can be both bred and taught, the combined abilities of Damia's children make them an even greater power than Damia or her mother. Each child has a special Talent that together makes them the most powerful Gwyn-Raven force yet to come. Unitedm they will confront the attackers face to face. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So Many Children
reviews.reviewText: Damia and Afra had eight children of which several are T-1. As they are getting older their time to take responsibilities to the F, T, and T. has arrived. Damia is especially concerned that they are all leaving home far to soon but each one has matured enough to be able to practice their Talents in New and surprising ways. Again another wonderful book by such a creative writer! Rest in Peace, Anne, your work will live on for many science fiction\fantasy readers for many years to come.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars What Happens to Damia's 4 oldest Prime Children?
reviews.reviewText: I really Loved that Anne McCaffrey continues the "Tower & Hive" Stories to the third Generation of Prime Talents. This Novel is mainly about the Action & Suspense, of Damia & Afra Lyon's 4 oldest children. I've Read this Outstanding, & Entertaining Series/Story several times, & found them/it Engrossing every time! In my opinion, this Novel is best read in sequence, the Third in the Series. I give "Damia's Children" my Highest Recommendation! ❤️📖 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Since meeting the ‘Dini the human race and Damia’s children have achieved so much that they have integrated into a better understanding of what to do with each other and the Hive situation. Almost all of Damia’s children are helping in some capacity in the search of Hivers or watching the Queen on the moon. Will it help them to figure out how to stop the Hivers from destroying people and planets or will they never find the solution?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I found this to be an issue excellent continuation of this story line. It is well worth reading. I have read it several times and always find it good reading.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Family saga continues
reviews.reviewText: Another enjoyable read by McCaffrey. Action, family interaction, and a book that was a pleasure to revisit. Too much of sify is thinly disguised horror. For entertainment and possibilities that don't leave me having nightmares there's nothing like a positive outlook on a future that leaves you hoping for the best.Always a good idea to read this series in order.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I LOVE THIS SERIES
reviews.reviewText: I LOVE THIS SERIES!!!! I loved it in paperback and am soooo glad they are finally putting it out on Kindle. It does seem a bit strange they have put this series out backward (the final book in the series came out not long after Kindles hit the market) but I will take it however I can get it. Now just waiting until "The Rowan" is available and I will be set!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2021
Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Together we can win
reviews.reviewText: The previous books in the series are individuals, this book tells the story of Damia's eight children they work with aliens, the military, the politicians, the doctors. Everyone works together even in some cases people who were enemies before. A great story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Purchased to replace print copy. Classic Talent story.

Love Anne McCaffrey books and the Rowen series (saga) is my favorite next to the brain ship sagaSo far replaced most of the Rowen saga except Rowen as that is NOT AVAILABLE.You can't go wrong in reading Anne McCaffrey :)
The continuing story of the talented and their friends .A must for Anne McCaffrey fans.It stands alone but is better when read in sequence.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great story in the Legacy of Damia and the rest of the siblings and their 'Dini friends.
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 18, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Bought this as a replacement for my printed copy, due to space limitations.
